notes.note:
On Windows, [updates can now be applied in the background][0] while Firefox is not running.

[0]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/enable-background-updates-firefox-windows

Firefox for Windows now offers a new page [about:third-party][0] to help identify compatibility issues caused by third-party applications

[0]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/identify-problems-caused-third-party-modules-firef

[Exceptions to HTTPS-Only mode][0] can be managed in about:preferences#privacy

[0]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/https-only-prefs
Print to PDF now produces working hyperlinks

[Version 2 of Firefox’s SmartBlock feature][0] further improves private browsing. Third-party Facebook scripts are blocked to prevent you from being tracked, but are now automatically loaded “just in time” if you decide to “Log in with Facebook” on any website.

[0]: https://blog.mozilla.org/security/2021/07/13/smartblock-v2/

The "Open Image in New Tab" context menu item now opens images and media in a background tab by default. [Learn more][0]

[0]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/tab-preferences-and-settings
Most users without hardware accelerated WebRender will now be using software WebRender.

Various bug fixes and new policies have been implemented in the latest version of Firefox. See more details in the [Firefox for Enterprise 90 Release Notes][0].

[0]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/firefox-enterprise-90-release-notes

system_requirements:
## Windows

### Operating Systems (32-bit and 64-bit)
 - Windows 7
 - Windows 8
 - Windows 10

### Recommended Hardware
-  Pentium 4 or newer processor that supports SSE2
-  512MB of RAM / 2GB of RAM for the 64-bit version
-  200MB of hard drive space

---

## Mac

### Operating Systems
- macOS 10.12
- macOS 10.13
- macOS 10.14
- macOS 10.15
- macOS 11

### Recommended Hardware
- Mac computer with an Intel x86 or Apple silicon processor
- 512 MB of RAM
- 200 MB hard drive space

---

## GNU/Linux

### Software Requirements

*Please note that GNU/Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*

- Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    - GTK+ 3.14 or higher
    - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
    - libstdc++ 4.8.1 or higher
    - glibc 2.17 or higher
- For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    - DBus 1.0 or higher
    - GNOME 2.16 or higher
    - PulseAudio
